etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London. From natron + -lite, after German Natrolith

definitions: The principal member of the zeolite group of minerals, which usually occurs as slender crystals or fibrous masses and is used in water softeners.

notes.text: Natrolite is a hydrous silicate of aluminium and sodium, Na₂Al₂Si₃O₁₀·2H₂O. Crystal system: orthorhombic.
